Package generation

package generation
This package contains classes used in the generation and representation of a maze.

For the maze representation, contributing classes are: BSPNode, BSPLeaf, BSPBranch, Distance, Floorplan, MazeContainer, Wall, and Wallboard. The MazeContainer class is a wrapper that represents an overall maze, other classes provide ingredients that are accessible through MazeContainer methods.

For the maze generation, clients interact with a Factory and provide it with an Order that the Factory then delivers. The MazeFactory is the class that implements the factory, the DefaultOrder is a class that implements an Order. The generation is performed in a background thread that such that the interaction with the factory is synchronous but triggers an asynchronous call to the actual generation which will eventually call the deliver method that acts as a callback method. The order carries not just the input specification on what kind of maze is wanted but after deliver is called also a reference to the resulting generated maze.

  • Interface Summary
    Interface
    Description
    Factory
    Specifies functionality of a maze factory that produces a maze with a background thread.
    Maze
    A Maze encapsulates all relevant information about a maze that can be explored in a game.
    Order
    An order describes functionality needed to order a maze from the maze factory.
  • Class Summary
    Class
    Description
    AllFloorplanTests
     
    BSPBranch
    BSPNodes are used to build a binary tree, where internal nodes keep track of lower and upper bounds of (x,y) coordinates.
    BSPBuilder
    This class has the responsibility to obtain the tree of BSP nodes for a given maze.
    BSPLeaf
    A leaf node for a tree of BSPNodes.
    BSPNode
    BSPNodes are used to build a binary tree, where internal nodes keep track of lower and upper bounds of (x,y) coordinates.
    DefaultOrder
    DefaultOrder provides a basic implementation for an order to interact with a MazeFactory by implementing the Order interface and to cater to a client class of the factory that wants to generate a maze.
    Distance
    This class has the responsibility to provide the distance for each cell to the exit of a maze.
    Floorplan
    This class represents the floorplan of a maze.
    FloorplanTest
    Tests individual methods of the Floorplan class.
    FloorplanTestIterator
     
    ListOfWallsBuilder
    This class creates a list of walls for a floorplan.
    MazeBuilder
    This class has the responsibility to create a maze of given dimensions (width, height) together with a solution based on a distance matrix.
    MazeBuilderBorukva
    A maze generation class that builds a maze using Boruvka's algorithm.
    MazeBuilderPrim
    This class has the responsibility to create a maze of given dimensions (width, height) together with a solution based on a distance matrix.
    MazeContainer
    Class encapsulates access to all information that constitutes a maze.
    MazeFactory
    This class encapsulates how a maze is generated.
    SingleRandom
    This class implements the generation of pseudo random numbers with a single instance of a random number generator.
    Wall
    A wall is a continuous sequence of wallboards in the maze.
    Wallboard
    Basic class to describe a wallboard which is located at a cell (x,y) and at that cell it is located in a particular direction.

    Enum Class
    Description
    CardinalDirection
    Represents absolute directions as for a map to match with the orientation on the screen, i.e.
    Order.Builder
    Lists all maze generation algorithms that are supported by the maze factory (Eller needs to be implemented for P2)
